main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Portland, Oregon on November 6, 1957. It was observed both visually and on ground-radar for approximately 10 minutes. The object was described as a red, glowing or fire-resembling light, moving in an east to west direction before disappearing from sight.
interesting points: The object was smaller than a nickel at its biggest and had a trail similar to ashes flipped from a cigarette according to one observer.
Weather conditions at the time of sighting were unusually clear and calm, with partial obscuration and a scattered layer at 16,000 feet.
The observers included a female housewife and a male employed by Boyd Rubber Co, both from Portland, Oregon.
One of the observers reported a passenger-type aircraft flying in the vicinity at the time of the UFO sighting.
The director of operations provided no comment or analysis on the reported UFO sighting.
sighted object: a red, glowing or fire-resembling light
witnesses: a female housewife and a male employed by Boyd Rubber Co
